trans-unit.source: Represents the details of a discovery reference without the contents of the referenced document.
This class cannot be inherited.

Using the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryClientProtocol.WriteAll%2A> method of <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryClientProtocol>, all valid referenced documents and a file containing a map of all save documents can be written to disk.
The file containing a map of all saved documents contains the details of each document as summarized by the properties of DiscoveryClientResult.

After the referenced documents and the map of the referenced documents have been written to disk using the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryClientProtocol.WriteAll%2A> method, you can invoke the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryClientProtocol.ReadAll%2A> method to read the discovery documents.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryClientResult"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the class and sets the property to referenceType, the property to url and the property to filename.
Name of the class representing the type of reference in the discovery document.
Sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryClientResult.ReferenceTypeName*> property.
URL for the reference.
Sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryClientResult.Url*> property.
Name of the file in which the reference was saved.
Sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryClientResult.Filename*> property.
Gets or sets the name of the file in which the reference is saved.
The name of the file is the name of the file saved on the local computer based on the contents of the file.
For instance, if the referenced file is a discovery document, the saved file will have a.disco extension on a Windows operating system.
Name of the file in which the reference is saved.
Name of the class representing the type of reference in the discovery document.
A reference within a discovery document can contain references to service descriptions, XSD schemas, or other discovery documents.

Therefore, ReferenceTypeName can have the following values: <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription>, <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema>, and <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryDocument>.
Name of the class representing the type of a reference.
Default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the URL for the reference.
The URL can refer to a discovery document, XML Schema Definition (XSD) schema, or a Service Description.
The URL of the reference.
